Text:
540p is not High resolution
Any TV made since 1949 can show 540p

720x1280(720p) is the lowest resolution that is defined as HiDef

If you're going to rip from BluRay at least keep the resolution above that of standard DVD's (800x600) or you're just wasting your time.

pickled egg: Old TV standard mean 720x576 or 720x480 and those are reffered as standard resolution.
960x540 is High(er) Resolution, hence its in the right cathegory. You are right that this is not quite HD resolution, but quality does not come only from resolution and its optimal choice for small size smartphone optimised movies.

if you want to know how this rip compares to other higher resolution 700MB rips here is your answer
http://screenshotcomparison.com/comparison/34546/
